alert.note: Alert for Edwards; Jefferson; Wabash; Wayne (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 26 at 3:40AM CDT until further notice by NWS Paducah
info.description: .A complex of thunderstorms producing very heavy rain will move into the Flood Watch area this morning. Rainfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour will be possible, and this will lead to the potential for flash flooding. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of southern Illinois, including the following areas, Edwards, Jefferson, Wabash and Wayne IL. * WHEN...Until 1 PM CDT this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Extensive street flooding and flooding of creeks and rivers are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rainfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour will be possible, and this will lead to the potential for flash flooding.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
